member.name: T:SimpleInjector.CyclicDependencyValidator
member.summary: Allows verifying whether a given type has a direct or indirect dependency on itself. Verifying is done by preventing recursive calls to a IInstanceProvider. An instance of this type is related to a single instance of a IInstanceProvider. A RecursiveDependencyValidator instance checks a single IInstanceProvider and therefore a single service type.

member.name: T:SimpleInjector.CyclicDependencyValidatorExtensions
member.summary: Extension methods for the RecursiveDependencyValidator class.

member.name: M:SimpleInjector.Container.Register``1
member.summary: Registers that a new instance of will be returned every time it is requested (transient). Note that calling this method is redundant in most scenarios, because the container will return a new instance for unregistered concrete types. Registration is needed when the security restrictions of the application's sandbox don't allow the container to create such type.
member.typeparam: The concrete type that will be registered.
member.exception: Thrown when this container instance is locked and can not be altered, or when an the has already been registered.
Thrown when the is a type that can not be created by the container.

member.summary: Registers that a new instance of will be returned every time a is requested.
member.typeparam: The interface or base type that can be used to retrieve the instances.
The concrete type that will be registered.
member.exception: Thrown when this container instance is locked and can not be altered, or when an the has already been registered.
Thrown when the given type is not a type that can be created by the container.

member.summary: Registers the specified delegate that allows constructing a single instance of . This delegate will be called at most once during the lifetime of the application.
member.typeparam: The interface or base type that can be used to retrieve instances.

member.name: M:SimpleInjector.Container.RegisterInitializer``1(System.Action{``0})
member.summary: Registers an delegate that runs after the creation of instances that implement or derive from the given . Please note that only instances that are created by the container (using constructor injection) can be initialized this way.
member.typeparam: The type for which the initializer will be registered.
member.param: The delegate that will be called after the instance has been constructed and before it is returned.
member.exception: Thrown when the is a null reference.
Thrown when this container instance is locked and can not be altered.

remarks.para: Multiple delegates can be registered per and multiple initializers can be applied on a created instance, before it is returned. For instance, when registering a for type , the delegate will be called for every instance created by the container, which can be nice for debugging purposes.
Note: Initializers are guaranteed to be executed in the order they are registered.
The following example shows the usage of the RegisterInitializer method:

The container does not use the type information of the requested service type, but it uses the type information of the actual implementation to find all initialized that apply for that type. This makes it possible to have multiple initializers to be applied on a single returned instance while keeping performance high.

member.name: M:SimpleInjector.Container.GetRegistration(System.Type)
member.summary: Gets the for the given . When no registration exists, the container will try creating a new producer. A producer can be created when the type is a concrete reference type, there is an event registered that acts on that type, or when the service type is an . Otherwise null (Nothing in VB) is returned.

remarks.para: A call to this method locks the container. No new registrations can be made after a call to this method.

Note: This method is not guaranteed to always return the same IInstanceProducer instance for a given . It will however either always return null or always return a producer that is able to return the expected instance.

member.param: The that the returned instance producer should produce.

member.name: M:SimpleInjector.Container.GetRegistration(System.Type,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the for the given . When no registration exists, the container will try creating a new producer. A producer can be created when the type is a concrete reference type, there is an event registered that acts on that type, or when the service type is an . Otherwise null (Nothing in VB) is returned, or an exception is throw when is set to true.

remarks.para: A call to this method locks the container. No new registrations can be made after a call to this method.

Note: This method is not guaranteed to always return the same IInstanceProducer instance for a given . It will however either always return null or always return a producer that is able to return the expected instance.

member.param: The that the returned instance producer should produce.
The indication whether the method should return null or throw an exception when the type is not registered.

member.name: M:SimpleInjector.Container.InjectProperties(System.Object)
member.summary: Injects all public writable properties of the given that have a type that can be resolved by this container instance.
member.param: The instance whos properties will be injected.
member.exception: Thrown when the is null (Nothing in VB).

Throw when injecting properties on the given instance failed due to security constraints of the sandbox. This can happen when injecting properties on an internal type in a Silverlight sandbox, or when running in partial trust.

member.name: M:SimpleInjector.Container.GetInitializer``1
member.summary: Builds up an delegate wrapping all delegates that are registered using RegisterInitializer and that apply to the given (including delegates that are registered for interfaces implements and base types that inherits from). Null will be returned when no delegates are registered that apply to this type.
member.typeparam: The type for with an initializer must be built.

member.name: M:SimpleInjector.Container.GetCurrentRegistrations
member.summary: Returns an array with the current registrations. This list contains all explicitly registered types, and all implictly registered instances. Implicit registrations are all concrete unregistered types that have been requested, all types that have been resolved using unregistered type resolution (using the event), and requested unregistered collections. Note that the result of this method may change over time, because of these implicit registrations. Because of this, users should not depend on this method as a reliable source of resolving instances. This method is provided for debugging purposes.

remarks.para: A call to this method locks the container. No new registrations can be made after a call to this method.

Note: This method is not guaranteed to always return the same IInstanceProducer instance for a given . It will however either always return null or always return a producer that is able to return the expected instance. Because of this, do not compare sets of instances returned by different calls to by reference. The way of comparing lists is by the actual type. The type of each instance is guaranteed to be unique in the returned list.

member.name: M:SimpleInjector.Container.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified System.Object is equal to the current System.Object.
member.param: The System.Object to compare with the current System.Object.
member.returns: True if the specified System.Object is equal to the current System.Object; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:SimpleInjector.Container.GetType

member.name: E:SimpleInjector.Container.ResolveUnregisteredType
member.summary: Occurs when an instance of a type is requested that has not been registered, allowing resolution of unregistered types.

remarks.para: The event is called by the container every time an unregistered type is requested, allowing a developer to do unregistered type resolution. By calling the Register method on the , a delegate can be hooked to the container allowing the container to retrieve instances of the requested type, and preventing the event from being called again for the same type.
This event is called before resolving concrete unregistered types, allowing a developer to intercept the creation of concrete types.

Thread-safety: Please note that the container will not ensure that the hooked delegates are executed only once. While the calls to for a given type are finite (and will in most cases happen just once), a container can call the delegate multiple times and make parallel calls to the delegate. You must make sure that the code can be called multiple times and is thread-safe.

member.name: E:SimpleInjector.Container.ExpressionBuilt
member.summary: Occurs after the creation of the Expression of a registered type, allowing the created Expression to be replaced. Multiple delegates may handle the same service type.

remarks.para: The event is called by the container every time an registered type is getting compiled, allowing a developer to change the way the type is created. The delegate that hooks to the event, can change the property on the , which allows changing the way the type is constructed.
This event is called after unregistered types are resolved.

Thread-safety: Please note that the container will not ensure that the hooked delegates are executed only once per service type. While the calls to for a given type are finite (and will in most cases happen just once), a container can call the delegate multiple times and make parallel calls to the delegate. You must make sure that the code can be called multiple times and is thread-safe.

member.name: T:SimpleInjector.UnregisteredTypeEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for and interaction with the ResolveUnregisteredType event of the . An observer can check the to see whether the unregistered type can be handled. The method can be called to register a delegate that allows creation of instances of the unregistered for this and future requests.

member.name: M:SimpleInjector.UnregisteredTypeEventArgs.#ctor(System.Type)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the UnregisteredTypeEventArgs class.
member.param: The unregistered service type.

member.name: M:SimpleInjector.UnregisteredTypeEventArgs.Register(System.Func{System.Object})
member.summary: Registers a delegate that allows creation of instances of the type expressed by the for this and future requests. The delegate will be caches and future requests will directly call that delegate.
member.param: The delegate that allows creation of instances of the type expressed by the .
member.exception: Thrown when the is a null reference.
Thrown when multiple observers that have registered to the ResolveUnregisteredType event called this method for the same type.

member.name: M:SimpleInjector.UnregisteredTypeEventArgs.Register(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression)
member.summary: Registers an that describes the creation of instances of the type expressed by the for this and future requests. The delegate will be caches and future requests will directly call that expression.
member.param: The expression that describes the creation of instances of the type expressed by the .
member.exception: Thrown when the is a null reference.
Thrown when the is a not exactly of type where T equals the .
Thrown when multiple observers that have registered to the ResolveUnregisteredType event called this method for the same type.
